standard_desc_eng: The Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) is a text-centric community of practice in the academic field of digital humanities, operating continuously since the 1980s. The community currently runs a mailing list, meetings and conference series, and maintains an eponymous technical standard, a journal, a wiki, a GitHub repository and a toolchain.
standard_desc_fr: La Text Encoding Initiative (abrÃÂ©gÃÂ© en TEI, en franÃÂ§ais ÃÂ« initiative pour lâencodage du texte ÃÂ») est une communautÃÂ© acadÃÂ©mique internationale dans le champ des humanitÃÂ©s numÃÂ©riques visant ÃÂ  dÃÂ©finir des recommandations pour lâencodage de documents textuels.
standard_desc_deu: Die Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) ist eine 1987 gegrÃÂ¼ndete Organisation (seit 2000 als TEI-Konsortium organisiert) und ein gleichnamiges Dokumentenformat zur Kodierung und zum Austausch von Texten, das diese entwickelt hat und weiterentwickelt. In der aktuellen Version P5 basiert das Format auf XML und ist in einer Metasprache definiert, aus der formale Schemata wie DTD, XML Schema und RELAX NG Schema abgeleitet werden kÃÂ¶nnen.
standard_desc_esp: La Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) es un consorcio que desarrolla y mantiene un estÃÂ¡ndar para la representaciÃÂ³n de los textos en forma digital. Se trata de un proyecto de investigaciÃÂ³n en humanidades digitales que goza de una amplÃÂ­sima difusiÃÂ³n y utilizaciÃÂ³n en bibliotecas y colecciones de texto digitales y en la creaciÃÂ³n de corpora lingÃÂ¼ÃÂ­sticos. Se basa en el lenguaje XML, una versiÃÂ³n simplificada del SGML.
standard_desc_ita: La Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) ÃÂ¨ un consorzio di istituzioni internazionali, di ambito linguistico e letterario, che ha sviluppato uno standard per la rappresentazione dei testi in forma digitale. La missione della TEI ÃÂ¨ quella di sviluppare e mantenere una serie di linee guida di alta qualitÃÂ  per la codifica di testi umanistici e per sostenere il loro uso da parte di comunitÃÂ  di progetti, istituzioni e singoli individui.

standard_desc_eng: An Open Archival Information System (or OAIS) is an archive, consisting of an organization of people and systems, that has accepted the responsibility to preserve information and make it available for a Designated Community. The term OAIS also refers, by extension, to the ISO OAIS Reference Model for an OAIS. This reference model is defined by recommendation CCSDS 650.0-B-2 of the Consultative Committee for Space Data Systems; this text is identical to ISO 14721:2012. The CCSDS's purview is space agencies, but the OAIS model it developed has proved useful to a wide variety of other organizations and institutions with digital archiving needs.
standard_desc_fr: L'Open Archival Information System ou OAIS (SystÃÂ¨me ouvert d'archivage d'information) est un modÃÂ¨le conceptuel destinÃÂ© ÃÂ  la gestion, ÃÂ  l'archivage et ÃÂ  la prÃÂ©servation ÃÂ  long terme de documents numÃÂ©riques. La mise au point de l'OAIS a ÃÂ©tÃÂ© pilotÃÂ©e par le Consultative Committee for Space Data Systems. L'OAIS est enregistrÃÂ© comme norme ISO sous la rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rence 14721:2012.
standard_desc_deu: OAIS (Open Archival Information System bzw. Offenes Archiv-Informations-System) ist ein Referenzmodell fÃÂ¼r ein dynamisches, erweiterungsfÃÂ¤higes Archivinformationssystem und als ISO-Standard 14721:2012 im August 2012 verÃÂ¶ffentlicht. Version 2 erweitert den ursprÃÂ¼nglichen ISO Standard aus dem Jahr 2003. Das OAIS Referenzmodell gilt als der wichtigste Standard fÃÂ¼r die elektronische Archivierung.
standard_desc_esp: Open Archival Information System (u OAIS) es un modelo conceptual destinado a la gestiÃÂ³n, al archivo y a la preservaciÃÂ³n a largo plazo de documentos. La actualizaciÃÂ³n ha sido dirigida por el Consultative Committee for Space Data Systems (CCSDS). OAIS se ha registrado como norma con la referencia ISO 14721:2003. Posteriormente se publicÃÂ³ una nueva versiÃÂ³n, en junio de 2012, ISO 14721:2012.
standard_desc_ita: OAIS (acronimo di Open Archival Information System) ÃÂ¨ lo standard ISO 14721:2003 e definisce concetti, modelli e funzionalitÃÂ  inerenti agli archivi digitali e gli aspetti di digital preservation.

standard_desc_eng: EAD stands for Encoded Archival Description, and is a non-proprietary de facto standard for the encoding of finding aids for use in a networked (online) environment. Finding aids are inventories, indexes, or guides that are created by archival and manuscript repositories to provide information about specific collections. While the finding aids may vary somewhat in style, their common purpose is to provide detailed description of the content and intellectual organization of collections of archival materials. EAD allows the standardization of collection information in finding aids within and across repositories.
standard_desc_fr: LâEncoded Archival Description (Description archivistique encodÃÂ©e) est un standard dâencodage des instruments de recherche archivistiques basÃÂ© sur le langage XML, maintenu par la SociÃÂ©tÃÂ© des archivistes amÃÂ©ricains en partenariat avec la BibliothÃÂ¨que du CongrÃÂ¨s. L'EAD est utilisÃÂ© internationalement, en particulier par les services dâarchives, bibliothÃÂ¨ques et musÃÂ©es pour dÃÂ©crire des fonds d'archives, des collections de manuscrits et des collections hiÃÂ©rarchisÃÂ©es de documents ou dâobjets (photographies, microfilms, piÃÂ¨ces de musÃÂ©e). Il est disponible sous la forme d'une DTD et d'un SchÃÂ©ma XML
standard_desc_deu: Encoded Archival Description (EAD) ist ein dokumentarischer XML-Standard zur Beschreibung von archivischen Findmitteln. Verantwortlich fÃÂ¼r die Definition von EAD ist das Technical Subcommittee for Encoded Archival Description der Society of American Archivists gemeinsam mit der Library of Congress. Eine erste Version wurde 1995 an der University of California, Berkeley in Form einer Dokumenttypdefinition (DTD) fÃÂ¼r SGML entwickelt. Die aktuelle Version (EAD3) wurde im August 2015 verÃÂ¶ffentlicht.
standard_desc_esp: La Encoded Archival Description (EAD, ÃÂ«DescripciÃÂ³n ArchivÃÂ­stica CodificadaÃÂ») es una norma que utiliza un vocabulario XML (Extensible Markup Language) para la codificaciÃÂ³n de instrumentos de descripciÃÂ³n de archivos con el fin de publicar, intercambiar y usar la informaciÃÂ³n archivÃÂ­stica a travÃÂ©s de internet. Dispone de herramientas para facilitar las bÃÂºsquedas, la recuperaciÃÂ³n y la navegaciÃÂ³n entre los distintos niveles de descripciÃÂ³n.
standard_desc_ita: L'EAD, Encoded Archival Description, ÃÂ¨ uno standard proposto come uno strumento per la conversione e la pubblicazione in formato elettronico di strumenti di ricerca archivistici prodotti originariamente su supporto cartaceo e la loro pubblicazione in formato elettronico nonchÃÂ© per l'elaborazione e lo scambio di descrizioni archivistiche in formato nativamente digitale. L'adozione di standard e tecnologie come XML che consentono la conservazione e la comunicazione dei dati, indipendentemente da specifiche piattaforme hardware e software, mira a garantire la persistenza della struttura e del contenuto delle descrizioni, e la loro accessibilitÃÂ  e validitÃÂ  nel tempo.

standard_desc_eng: Encoded Archival Context - Corporate bodies, Persons and Families (EAC-CPF) is an XML standard for encoding information about the creators of archival materials -- i.e., a corporate body, person or family -- including their relationships to (a) resources (books, collections, papers, etc.) and (b) other corporate bodies, persons and families. The goal is to provide contextual information regarding the circumstances of record creation and use. EAC-CPF can be used in conjunction with Encoded Archival Description (EAD) for enhancement of EAD's capabilities in encoding finding aids, but can also be used in conjunction with other standards or for standalone authority file encoding.
standard_desc_fr: L'Encoded Archival Context - Corporate Bodies, Persons and Families communÃÂ©ment dÃÂ©signÃÂ©e sous le sigle EAC-CPF est une dÃÂ©finition de type de document (DTD) consacrÃÂ©e aux personnes, morales ou physiques, dont ÃÂ©manent les archives et rÃÂ©digÃÂ©e en XML. LâEAC-CPF est distincte de l'EAD et permet la description des collectivitÃÂ©s, des personnes et des familles de maniÃÂ¨re autonome. Les collectivitÃÂ©s, personnes et familles peuvent ÃÂªtre des ÃÂ©lÃÂ©ments majeurs dans le cycle de vie d'un document d'archive, mais surtout dans leur utilisation, les multiples relations que peuvent entretenir peuvent ÃÂªtre gÃÂ©rÃÂ©es grÃÂ¢ce ÃÂ  l'EAC-CPF qui les met en relation avec les descriptions archivistiques en EAD. Elle fixe aussi un cadre pour le partage et la rÃÂ©utilisation de ces informations.
standard_desc_deu: Encoded Archival Context â Corporate bodies, Persons, and Families (EAC-CPF oder kurz EAC) ist ein Standard fÃÂ¼r eine XML-Struktur zur Kodierung von Meta-Informationen ÃÂ¼ber die Herkunft und Benutzungsgeschichte von Archivgut. Solche Metadaten kÃÂ¶nnen z. B. Angaben ÃÂ¼ber die abgebende BehÃÂ¶rde oder frÃÂ¼here Besitzer (Provenienz), die UmstÃÂ¤nde der Bestandsbildung usw. sein, aber auch Angaben ÃÂ¼ber Beziehungen zwischen dem im Bestand ÃÂ¼berlieferten Material und realen Personen, Organisationen oder Unternehmen. EAC-CPF wird in ErgÃÂ¤nzung zur Encoded Archival Description (EAD) von der Society of American Archivists in Zusammenarbeit mit der Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin (SBPK) entwickelt.
standard_desc_ita: EAC-CPF - Encoded Archival Context-Corporate Bodies, Persons and Families intende costituire uno standard per la codifica in XML e l'interscambio di record di autoritÃÂ  basati sull'International Standard Archival Authority Records for Corporate Bodies, Persons and Families â ISAAR (CPF).

standard_desc_eng: Encoded Archival Guide (EAG) is intended to provide a standard for the description of archives. The Spanish Ministry of Culture has developed EAG 2002 for the Spanish-language archive portal "Censo-GuÃÂ­a de Archivos de EspaÃÂ±a e IberoamÃÂ©rica", together with the corresponding XML structure, to encode information about archives, such as address, opening hours, technical equipment, etc. A corresponding ICA standard was published in 2008 as the International Standard for Describing Institutions with Archival Holdings (ISDIAH).
standard_desc_deu: Encoded Archival Guide (EAG) ist ein Entwurf fÃÂ¼r einen Standard und die dazugehÃÂ¶rige XML-Struktur zur Codierung von Informationen ÃÂ¼ber Archive, wie z. B. Adresse, ÃÂffnungszeiten oder technische Ausstattung. Es ergÃÂ¤nzt die archivischen Standards Encoded Archival Description (EAD) und Encoded Archival Context (EAC) um eine MÃÂ¶glichkeit, detaillierte Informationen zu denjenigen Institutionen bereitzustellen, die in elektronischen Findmitteln nachgewiesene BestÃÂ¤nde bereithalten.
standard_desc_ita: L'EAG, Encoded Archival Guide, ÃÂ¨ lo standard per la marcatura in formato XML dei metadati descrittivi relativi ai soggetti conservatori d'archivi.

standard_desc_eng: The CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model (CRM) provides an extensible ontology for concepts and information in cultural heritage and museum documentation. It is the international standard (ISO 21127:2014) for the controlled exchange of cultural heritage information. Galleries, libraries, archives, museums (GLAMs), and other cultural institutions are encouraged to use the CIDOC CRM to enhance accessibility to museum-related information and knowledge.
standard_desc_fr: Le modÃÂ¨le sÃÂ©mantique de rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rence CIDOC CRM est un modÃÂ¨le conceptuel propre au patrimoine culturel. Ce modÃÂ¨le de rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rence est utilisÃÂ© pour reprÃÂ©senter les collections afin d'amÃÂ©liorer le partage d'information sur ces collections et ces entitÃÂ©s.
standard_desc_deu: Das CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model bietet eine erweiterbare Ontologie fÃÂ¼r Begriffe und Informationen im Bereich des Kulturerbes. Es ist eine Norm (ISO 21127:2006)[1] fÃÂ¼r den kontrollierten Austausch von Informationen im Bereich des kulturellen Erbes und soll unter anderem von Archiven, Bibliotheken und Museen zur Verbesserung der VerfÃÂ¼gbarkeit von Wissen angewandt werden.
standard_desc_ita: CIDOC-CRM ÃÂ¨ uno standard internazionale ormai largamente accettato come sistema di riferimento per strutturare la documentazione dei beni culturali e realizzare interconnessioni e interoperabilitÃÂ  fra diverse strutture di dati.

standard_desc_eng: Component MetaData Infrastructure(CMDI)describes a model that enables the flexible construction of interoperable metadata schemas for Language Resources (LRs). The metadata schemas based on this model can be used to describe resources at different levels of granularity (e.g. descriptions both on the collection level and on the level of individual resources).

ALTO (Analyzed Layout and Text Object) is an open XML Schema developed by the EU-funded project called METAe. The standard was initially developed for the description of text OCR and layout information of pages for digitized material. The goal was to describe the layout and text in a form to be able to reconstruct the original appearance based on the digitized information - similar to the approach of a lossless image saving operation. ALTO is often used in combination with Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS) for the description of the whole digitized object and creation of references across the ALTO files, e.g. reading sequence description.
standard_desc_fr: ALTO (Analysed Layout and Text Object) est un standard XML permettant de rendre compte de la mise en page physique et de la structure logique d'un texte transcrit par reconnaissance optique de caractÃÂ¨res (OCR). Le format est issu du projet europÃÂ©en METAe.
standard_desc_esp: ALTO (Analized Layout and Text Object) es un esquema XML (usado para almacenar informaciÃÂ³n en forma electrÃÂ³nica) que detalla los metadatos tÃÂ©cnicos para describir el diseÃÂ±o grÃÂ¡fico y el texto de las imÃÂ¡genes digitales -ej. pÃÂ¡ginas de un libro o periÃÂ³dico-, obtenido por medio de un reconocimiento ÃÂ³ptico de caracteres. Se iniciÃÂ³ en un proyecto europeo denominado METAe. Su finalidad es describir el texto y su disposiciÃÂ³n en la pÃÂ¡gina de una forma que haga posible reconstruir la apariencia original basÃÂ¡ndose en la informaciÃÂ³n de la pÃÂ¡gina digitalizada; un enfoque similar al de una operaciÃÂ³n de guardar la imagen sin pÃÂ©rdida de informaciÃÂ³n por compresiÃÂ³n.

standard_desc_eng: The Music Encoding Initiative (MEI) is an open-source effort to create a system for representation musical documents in a machine-readable structure. MEI closely mirrors work done by text scholars in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and while the two encoding initiatives are not formally related, they share many common characteristics and development practices. The term "MEI", like "TEI", describes the governing organization and the markup language.
standard_desc_fr: Music Encoding Initiative (MEI) est un projet open-source visant ÃÂ  crÃÂ©er un systÃÂ¨me de reprÃÂ©sentation interne de documents musicaux. MEI s'appuie fortement sur le travail effectuÃÂ© par les chercheurs en littÃÂ©rature au sein de Text Encoding Initiative (TEI), et alors que les deux initiatives de codage ne sont pas formellement liÃÂ©es, elles partagent de nombreuses caractÃÂ©ristiques et des pratiques de dÃÂ©veloppement communes. Le terme "MEI", comme "TEI", dÃÂ©crit ÃÂ  la fois l'organe de gouvernance et le langage de balisage.
standard_desc_deu: Die Music Encoding Initiative (MEI) ist ein Open-Source-Projekt und gleichnamiges Dokumentenformat zur Kodierung, Austausch und Archivierung von Musik, welches von der MEI entwickelt wird. Das Projekt wird auf GitHub gehostet und von der Akademie der Wissenschaften und der Literatur betreut. Sowohl durch die Kopplung von Organisation und Format als auch bezÃÂ¼glich der Zielsetzung ÃÂ¤hnelt sie der Text Encoding Initiative.

standard_desc_eng: Morpho-syntactic annotation framework(MAF)provides a framework for the representation of annotations of word-forms in texts; such annotations concern tokens, their relationship with lexical units, and their morpho-syntactic properties.
Extensible Markup Language (XML) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.
standard_desc_fr: L'Extensible Markup Language (XML, ÃÂ«langage de balisage extensibleÃÂ» en franÃÂ§ais) est un mÃÂ©talangage informatique de balisage gÃÂ©nÃÂ©rique qui dÃÂ©rive du SGML. Cette syntaxe est dite ÃÂ« extensible ÃÂ» car elle permet de dÃÂ©finir diffÃÂ©rents espaces de noms, c'est-ÃÂ -dire des langages avec chacun leur vocabulaire et leur grammaire, comme XHTML, XSLT, RSS, SVGâ¦
standard_desc_deu: Die Erweiterbare Auszeichnungssprache (englisch Extensible Markup Language), abgekÃÂ¼rzt XML, ist eine Auszeichnungssprache zur Darstellung hierarchisch strukturierter Daten im Format einer Textdatei, die sowohl von Menschen- als auch von Maschinen lesbar ist.
standard_desc_esp: XML, siglas en inglÃÂ©s de eXtensible Markup Language, traducido como "Lenguaje de Marcado Extensible" o "Lenguaje de Marcas Extensible", es un meta-lenguaje que permite definir lenguajes de marcas desarrollado por el World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) utilizado para almacenar datos en forma legible.
standard_desc_ita: XML (sigla di eXtensible Markup Language) ÃÂ¨ un metalinguaggio per la definizione di linguaggi di markup, ovvero un linguaggio marcatore basato su un meccanismo sintattico che consente di definire e controllare il significato degli elementi contenuti in un documento o in un testo.

standard_complete_name: Historical International Standard of Classification of Occupations
standard_desc_eng: The Historical International Standard of Classification of Occupations or HISCO is a theoretical model used to code social class and occupational status. Formulated in 2002, the model complements the ILO's ISCO68 scheme, as it prescribes a universal code system for examining occupation descriptions.

LIDO (Lightweight Information Describing Objects) is an XML schema for describing museum objects. It is applicable to all kinds of objects: art, natural history, technology, cultural objects. LIDO is widely used for harvesting museum data in union catalogs, and as a preliminary step for converting to semantic formats like CIDOC CRM or EDM.
standard_desc_deu: Bei dem Datenformat Lightweight Information Describing Objects kurz LIDO handelt es sich um die internationale Weiterentwicklung des unten beschriebenen Formates museumdat. Die Informationen ÃÂ¼ber LIDO werden von der Arbeitsgruppe Data Harvesting and Interchange des International Committee on Documentation bereitgestellt.

standard_desc_eng: The Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS) is a metadata standard for encoding descriptive, administrative, and structural metadata regarding objects within a digital library, expressed using the XML schema language of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C).
standard_desc_fr: METS (Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard) est un schÃÂ©ma XML dÃÂ©veloppÃÂ© ÃÂ  l'initiative de la Digital Library Federation (DLF), et autorisant la crÃÂ©ation et la description intÃÂ©grale (donnÃÂ©es descriptives, administratives et structurelles) d'objets numÃÂ©riques textuels ou graphiques.
standard_desc_deu: Der Metadata Encoding und Transmission Standard (METS) ist ein mit XML Schema definiertes XML-Format zur Beschreibung von digitalen Sammlungen von Objekten mit Metadaten.
standard_desc_esp: Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS, EstÃÂ¡ndar de codificaciÃÂ³n y transmisiÃÂ³n de metadatos) es un estÃÂ¡ndar de metadatos para codificar en formato electrÃÂ³nico un documento u objeto dentro de una biblioteca digital. Se utiliza un esquema de lenguaje XML de la World Wide Web Consortium (W3C).
standard_desc_ita: METS - Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard ÃÂ¨ uno standard per codificare in XML metadati descrittivi, amministrativi e strutturali riguardanti le risorse digitali.

standard_desc_eng: The Metadata Object Description Schema (MODS) is an XML-based bibliographic description schema developed by the United States Library of Congress' Network Development and Standards Office. MODS was designed as a compromise between the complexity of the MARC format used by libraries and the extreme simplicity of Dublin Core metadata.
standard_desc_fr: Le Metadata Object Description Schema (MODS) est un vocabulaire XML de description bibliographique dÃÂ©veloppÃÂ© en 2002 par le Bureau des normes et du dÃÂ©veloppement du rÃÂ©seau de la BibliothÃÂ¨que du CongrÃÂ¨s. MODS a ÃÂ©tÃÂ© conÃÂ§u comme un compromis entre la complexitÃÂ© du format MARC utilisÃÂ© par les bibliothÃÂ¨ques et l'extrÃÂªme simplicitÃÂ© du jeu de mÃÂ©tadonnÃÂ©es Dublin Core.
standard_desc_deu: Das Metadata Object Description Schema (MODS) ist ein XML-Format fÃÂ¼r bibliografische Metadaten. Es wird als XML-Schema vom Network Development and MARC Standards Office der Library of Congress entwickelt und verwaltet, seit Juli 2015 liegt es in der Version 3.6 vor.

standard_desc_eng: The Data Documentation Initiative (also known as DDI or DDI Metadata) is an international standard for describing surveys, questionnaires, statistical data files, and social sciences study-level information. This information is described as metadata by the standard.
standard_desc_fr: Data Documentation Initiative (DDI) est un projet international initiÃÂ© en 1995 destinÃÂ© ÃÂ  crÃÂ©er et maintenir un standard de documentation technique pour dÃÂ©crire et conserver les informations statistiques et plus globalement les informations et donnÃÂ©es d'enquÃÂªtes en sciences humaines et sociales.
standard_desc_deu: DDI ist ein offener Standard (Metadatenmodell) fÃÂ¼r die Beschreibung von sozial- und wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Daten. Grundlegendes Konzept der Version DDI 3.X ist die Beschreibung des vollstÃÂ¤ndigen Datenlebenszyklus, dem sogenannten Data Life Cycle, mittels XML.

standard_desc_eng: The Dublin Core Schema is a small set of vocabulary terms that can be used to describe web resources (video, images, web pages, etc.), as well as physical resources such as books or CDs, and objects like artworks. The full set of Dublin Core metadata terms can be found on the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI) website.
standard_desc_fr: Le Dublin Core est un schÃÂ©ma de mÃÂ©tadonnÃÂ©es gÃÂ©nÃÂ©rique qui permet de dÃÂ©crire des ressources numÃÂ©riques ou physiques et dâÃÂ©tablir des relations avec d'autres ressources. Il comprend officiellement 15 ÃÂ©lÃÂ©ments de description formels (titre, crÃÂ©ateur, ÃÂ©diteur), thÃÂ©matiques (sujet, description, langueâ¦) et relatifs ÃÂ  la propriÃÂ©tÃÂ© intellectuelle.
standard_desc_deu: Dublin Core ist ein bibliographisches Datenformat. Genauer handelt es sich um eine Sammlung einfacher und standardisierter Konventionen zur Beschreibung von Dokumenten und anderen Objekten im Internet, um diese mit Hilfe von Metadaten einfacher auffindbar zu machen. Urheber dieses Schemas ist die 'Dublin Core Metadata Initiative' (DCMI).
standard_desc_esp: Dublin Core es un modelo de metadatos elaborado y auspiciado por la DCMI (Dublin Core Metadata Initiative), una organizaciÃÂ³n dedicada a fomentar la adopciÃÂ³n extensa de los estÃÂ¡ndares interoperables de los metadatos y a promover el desarrollo de los vocabularios especializados de metadatos para describir recursos para permitir sistemas mÃÂ¡s inteligentes el descubrimiento del recurso.
standard_desc_ita: Il Dublin Core ÃÂ¨ un sistema di metadati costituito da un nucleo di elementi essenziali ai fini della descrizione di qualsiasi materiale digitale accessibile via rete informatica.

standard_desc_eng: Schematron is a rule-based validation language for making assertions about the presence or absence of patterns in XML trees. It is a structural schema language expressed in XML using a small number of elements and XPath.
standard_desc_fr: Schematron est un langage permettant de valider la structure d'un document XML par une liste d'assertions. Schematron permet de dÃÂ©finir des contraintes complexes, que d'autres langages de validation XML ne permettent pas.
standard_desc_deu: Schematron ist eine Schemasprache zur Validierung von Inhalt und Struktur von XML-Dokumenten. Die Implementierung der Sprache ist ÃÂ¼ber XSL-Transformationen realisiert, bedarf also keiner speziellen Implementierung, wie es bei den meisten anderen Dokumentstruktur-Definitionssprachen der Fall ist.
standard_desc_esp: Schematron se engloba dentro de la familia de lenguajes de marcado XML, siendo un lenguaje de validaciÃÂ³n basado en reglas y en XPATH. Se basa en afirmaciones en vez de en gramÃÂ¡tica. Utiliza expresiones de acceso en lugar de gramaticales para definir lo que se permite y lo que no se permite en un documento XML.

standard_desc_eng: The Europeana Data Model (EDM) is a richer metadata standard introduced to help give users more and better information.
standard_desc_ita: L'EDM, Europeana Data Model, ÃÂ¨ uno standard per la condivisione dei contenuti fornito da Europeana.

standard_desc_eng: DM2E (Data Model to Europeana) is building the tools and communities to enable humanities researchers to work with manuscripts in the Linked Open Web.

The standard installation of AtoM is used in conjunction with a CENDARI theme. In addition CENDARI developed a Shibboleth authentication extension and a script to upload AtoM archival descriptions in EAD and EAG to the CENDARI repository.
MDV is MeDieVal Extension of DM2E model developed by SISMEL for the study of medieval manuscripts.

FOAF (an acronym of friend of a friend) is a machine-readable ontology describing persons, their activities and their relations to other people and objects. Anyone can use FOAF to describe themselves. FOAF allows groups of people to describe social networks without the need for a centralised database. FOAF is a descriptive vocabulary expressed using the Resource Description Framework (RDF) and the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
standard_desc_fr: FOAF (de l'anglais Friend of a friend, littÃÂ©ralement ÃÂ« lâami dâun ami ÃÂ») est une ontologie RDF permettant de dÃÂ©crire des personnes et les relations quâelles entretiennent entre elles. UtilisÃÂ©e comme rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rence par plusieurs centaines d'autres vocabulaires, elle est un ÃÂ©lÃÂ©ment central du web sÃÂ©mantique.
standard_desc_deu: FOAF (Friend of a Friend) ist eine Ontologie zur maschinenlesbaren Modellierung sozialer Netzwerke. HerzstÃÂ¼ck des Projekts ist ein RDF-Schema, das Klassen und Eigenschaften definiert, die in einem XML-basierten RDF-Dokument verwendet werden kÃÂ¶nnen. Es handelt sich bei FOAF um eine der ersten Anwendungen von Semantic-Web-Technologien.
standard_desc_esp: FOAF (Friend Of A Friend, literalmente "Amigo de un Amigo") es una ontologÃÂ­a legible para las mÃÂ¡quinas que describe a las personas, sus actividades y sus relaciones con otras personas y objetos. Para hacer estas descripciones utiliza el Marco de DescripciÃÂ³n (RDF por sus siglas en inglÃÂ©s) y el lenguaje de marcado OWL.
standard_desc_ita: FOAF (acronimo di Friend of a friend) ÃÂ¨ un'ontologia comprensibile dal computer atta a descrivere persone, con le loro attivitÃÂ  e le relazioni con altre persone e oggetti. Chiunque puÃÂ² usare FOAF per descriversi. FOAF permette a gruppi di persone di descrivere quel fenomeno noto come social network senza la necessitÃÂ  di un database centralizzato. FOAF ÃÂ¨ un vocabolario descrittivo espresso in Resource Description Framework (RDF) ed ÃÂ¨ definito usando Web Ontology Language (OWL).

standard_desc_eng: The Integrated Authority File (German: Gemeinsame Normdatei, also known as: Universal Authority File) or GND is an international authority file for the organisation of personal names, subject headings and corporate bodies from catalogues. It is used mainly for documentation in libraries and increasingly also by archives and museums.
standard_desc_fr: Le Gemeinsame Normdatei ou GND, appelÃÂ© en anglais Integrated Authority File, est un type d'autoritÃÂ© international pour les personnes physiques et morales ainsi que pour les thÃÂ¨mes. GÃÂ©rÃÂ© par la BibliothÃÂ¨que nationale allemande, il est principalement utilisÃÂ© pour rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rencer la littÃÂ©rature dans les bibliothÃÂ¨ques et les archives et fusionne plusieurs anciens types.
standard_desc_deu: Die Gemeinsame Normdatei (GND) ist eine Normdatei fÃÂ¼r Personen, KÃÂ¶rperschaften, Kongresse, Geografika, SachschlagwÃÂ¶rter und Werktitel, die vor allem zur Katalogisierung von Literatur in Bibliotheken dient, zunehmend aber auch von Archiven, Museen, Projekten und in Web-Anwendungen genutzt wird.
standard_desc_esp: El Gemeinsame Normdatei (GND, en inglÃÂ©s: Integrated Authority File), es un ÃÂ­ndice estandarizado de control de autoridades para datos de personas, instituciones, congresos, datos geogrÃÂ¡ficos, descriptores y palabras clave, asÃÂ­ como tÃÂ­tulos de obras, al servicio principalmente de la catalogaciÃÂ³n de literatura en bibliotecas y crecientemente tambiÃÂ©n para la categorizaciÃÂ³n en archivos, museos, proyectos y aplicaciones web.
standard_desc_ita: Il Gemeinsame Normdatei (GND) ÃÂ¨ un sistema di controllo di autoritÃÂ  gestito dalla Biblioteca nazionale tedesca in collaborazione con altre biblioteche, principalmente di aree di lingua tedesca, che ne curano gli aggiornamenti tramite OAI. Serve per catalogare dati su persone, persone giuridiche, enti, opere, argomenti, congressi ed eventi, elementi geografici. Viene utilizzato principalmente dalle biblioteche, ma in maniera crescente anche da archivi, musei e per applicazioni in rete.

standard_desc_eng: The Virtual International Authority File (VIAF) is an international authority file. It is a joint project of several national libraries and operated by the Online Computer Library Center (OCLC). The aim is to link the national authority files (such as the German Name Authority File) to a single virtual authority file. In this file, identical records from the different data sets are linked together.
standard_desc_fr: Le fichier dâautoritÃÂ© international virtuel (Virtual International Authority File : VIAF) est un fichier d'autoritÃÂ© international pour identifier les personnes ou collectivitÃÂ©s contenues dans d'autres fichiers d'autoritÃÂ©. La consultation de ce fichier est offerte gratuitement aux bibliothÃÂ¨ques et aux particuliers par le web, et permet de mettre en relation les notices d'autoritÃÂ© des diffÃÂ©rentes bibliothÃÂ¨ques concernant une mÃÂªme personne, par un identifiant VIAF (URI).
standard_desc_deu: Das Virtual International Authority File (VIAF) ist eine virtuelle internationale Normdatei fÃÂ¼r Personendaten. Es ist ein Gemeinschaftsprojekt mehrerer Nationalbibliotheken und BibliotheksverbÃÂ¼nde, das durch das Online Computer Library Center (OCLC) betrieben wird. Das Projekt wurde 2003 gemeinsam von der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek und der Library of Congress initiiert und nahm 2012 seinen regulÃÂ¤ren Betrieb auf.
standard_desc_esp: El Fichero de Autoridades Virtual Internacional (FAVI), en inglÃÂ©s: Virtual International Authority File (VIAF) es un proyecto de bibliotecas nacionales y operado por el Online Computer Library Center (OCLC) para unir los ficheros de autoridad virtual de aquellas bibliotecas. El proyecto fue iniciado por la Biblioteca Nacional de Alemania y por la Biblioteca del Congreso de los EE. UU. a la que se unieron la Biblioteca Nacional de EspaÃÂ±aâ entre otras.
standard_desc_ita: Il Virtual International Authority File (acronimo: VIAF) ÃÂ¨ un progetto internazionale che ha dato vita ad un'unica base dati di voci di autoritÃÂ  controllate, (ca. 20 milioni di autori provenienti da 24 cataloghi collettivi nazionali) a disposizione quale servizio gratuito del web semantico; in essa l'utente puÃÂ² cercare un autore utilizzando la forma del nome utilizzata nella propria lingua, scrittura e alfabeto preferiti e accedere immediatamente ai cataloghi nazionali o internazionali corrispondenti per visualizzare la lista delle loro opere.

standard_complete_name: Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting
standard_desc_eng: The Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH) is a protocol developed for harvesting (or collecting) metadata descriptions of records in an archive so that services can be built using metadata from many archives. An implementation of OAI-PMH must support representing metadata in Dublin Core, but may also support additional representations.
standard_desc_fr: Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH) est un protocole informatique dÃÂ©veloppÃÂ© par l'Open Archives Initiative afin d'ÃÂ©changer des mÃÂ©tadonnÃÂ©es. Il permet de constituer et de mettre ÃÂ  jour automatiquement des entrepÃÂ´ts centralisÃÂ©s oÃÂ¹ les mÃÂ©tadonnÃÂ©es de sources diverses peuvent ÃÂªtre interrogÃÂ©es simultanÃÂ©ment. UtilisÃÂ© notamment par les Archives Ouvertes et les entrepÃÂ´ts institutionnels, il s'est aujourd'hui largement rÃÂ©pandu dans les institutions patrimoniales et notamment les bibliothÃÂ¨ques.
standard_desc_deu: Die Open Archives Initiative (OAI) ist eine Initiative von Betreibern von Preprint- und anderen Dokumentenservern, um die auf diesen Servern abgelegten elektronischen Publikationen im Internet besser auffindbar und nutzbar zu machen. Dazu werden verschiedene einfache Techniken entwickelt und bereitgestellt, insbesondere das OAI Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH, engl.) zum Einsammeln und Weiterverarbeiten von Metadaten.
standard_desc_esp: Open Archive Initiative-Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH) estÃÂ¡ financiado por National Science Foundation, y tiene como misiÃÂ³n desarrollar y promover estÃÂ¡ndares de interoperabilidad para facilitar la difusiÃÂ³n eficiente de contenidos en Internet. Se centra en la transmisiÃÂ³n de metadatos sobre cualquier material en soporte electrÃÂ³nico, siendo un requisito esencial que ÃÂ©stos se codifiquen en Dublin Core.
standard_desc_ita: OAI-PMH (Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting o Protocollo per il raccoglimento dei metadati dell'Open Archive Initiative) ÃÂ¨ un protocollo sviluppato dall'Open Archives Initiative come infrastruttura di comunicazione per l'Open access. ÃÂ utilizzato per raccogliere (o collezionare) i metadati dei documenti in un archivio affinchÃÂ© i servizi possano essere costruiti utilizzando metadati da piÃÂ¹ archivi. Una implementazione dell'OAI-PMH deve supportare metadati rappresentati in Dublin Core, ma puÃÂ² supportare altre rappresentazioni.

standard_desc_eng: The TCF format (Text Corpus Format) is used by WebLicht services as a machine-readable format for representing and exchanging linguistically annotated texts. It enables interoperability of linguistic tools. WebLicht developer manual provides detailed information on the TCF format and its background.

LAF, linguistic annotation framework, is a standard ISO for representing linguistic annotations of language data such as corpora, speech signal and video. The framework includes an abstract data model and an XML serialization of that model for representing annotations of primary data. The serialization serves as a pivot format to allow annotations expressed in one representation format to be mapped onto another.
The International Standard Classification of Occupations (ISCO) is an International Labour Organization (ILO) classification structure for organizing information on labour and jobs.
standard_desc_fr: La CITP ou classification internationale type des professions (ISCO en anglais) est une nomenclature internationale. Elle sert ÃÂ  identifier aussi prÃÂ©cisÃÂ©ment que possible chaque mÃÂ©tier, et sert de correspondance entre les nomemclatures nationales, pour faciliter les comparaisons entre pays.
standard_desc_deu: Die Berufssystematik International Standard Classification of Occupations (deutsch Internationale Standardklassifikation der Berufe) ist ein von der Internationalen Arbeitsorganisation (ILO) zusammengestelltes, international gÃÂ¼ltiges monohierarchisches Klassifikationsschema fÃÂ¼r Gruppen von Berufen.
standard_desc_esp: La ClasificaciÃÂ³n Internacional Uniforme de Ocupaciones (CIUO), tambiÃÂ©n conocida por sus siglas en inglÃÂ©s ISCO, es una estructura de clasificaciÃÂ³n de la OrganizaciÃÂ³n Internacional del Trabajo (OIT) para organizar la informaciÃÂ³n de trabajo y empleo.

standard_desc_eng: Laser Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy (LIBS) is an analytical technique that enables the determination of the elemental composition of materials on the basis of the characteristic atomic emission from a micro-plasma produced by focusing a high-power laser on or in a material.

Raman spectroscopy is a spectroscopic technique used to observe vibrational, rotational, and other low-frequency modes in a system. Raman spectroscopy is commonly used in chemistry to provide a structural fingerprint by which molecules can be identified.
standard_desc_fr: La spectroscopie Raman et la microspectroscopie Raman sont des mÃÂ©thodes non destructives d'observation et de caractÃÂ©risation de la composition molÃÂ©culaire et de la structure externe d'un matÃÂ©riau, qui exploite le phÃÂ©nomÃÂ¨ne physique selon lequel un milieu modifie lÃÂ©gÃÂ¨rement la frÃÂ©quence de la lumiÃÂ¨re y circulant. Ce dÃÂ©calage en frÃÂ©quence dit l'effet Raman correspond ÃÂ  un ÃÂ©change d'ÃÂ©nergie entre le rayon lumineux et le milieu, et donne des informations sur le substrat lui-mÃÂªme. La spectroscopie Raman consiste ÃÂ  envoyer une lumiÃÂ¨re monochromatique sur lâÃÂ©chantillon et ÃÂ  analyser la lumiÃÂ¨re diffusÃÂ©e.

standard_desc_eng: Laser-induced fluorescence (LIF) is a spectroscopic method in which an atom or molecule is excited to a higher energy level by the absorption of laser light followed by spontaneous emission of light. LIF is used for studying structure of molecules, detection of selective species and flow visualization and measurements. The excitation wavelength is often selected to be the one at which the species has its largest cross section. The excited species decay usually after a few nanoseconds to microseconds, and emit light at a wavelength longer than the excitation wavelength.

X-ray fluorescence is the emission of characteristic "secondary" (or fluorescent) X-rays from a material that has been excited by bombarding with high-energy X-rays or gamma rays. The phenomenon is widely used for elemental analysis and chemical analysis, particularly in the investigation of metals, glass, ceramics and building materials, and for research in geochemistry, forensic science, archaeology and art objects such as paintings and murals.

Multispectral imaging, like other spectral imaging, collects and processes information from across the electromagnetic spectrum. The goal of Multispectral imaging is to obtain the spectrum for each pixel in the image of a scene, with the purpose of finding objects, identifying materials, or detecting processes.

standard_complete_name: Electronic still-picture imaging -- Removable memory -- Part 2: TIFF/EP image data format
standard_desc_eng: Tag Image File Format/Electronic Photography (TIFF/EP) is a digital image file format standard â ISO 12234-2, titled "Electronic still-picture imaging â Removable memory â Part 2: TIFF/EP image data format". The TIFF/EP standard is based on a subset of the Adobe TIFF standard, and a subset of the JEITA Exif standard, with some differences and extensions.

standard_complete_name: Conservation of cultural heritage - Cleaning of porous inorganic materials - Laser cleaning techniques for cultural heritage
standard_desc_eng: This European standard applies to porous inorganic materials constituting cultural heritage. It provides the fundamental requirements of the laser parameters and guidelines for the choice of the laser operational parameters, in order to optimize the cleaning procedure.
standard_desc_esp: Esta norma europea se aplica a los materiales inorgÃÂ¡nicos porosos que constituyen el patrimonio cultural. Proporciona los requisitos fundamentales de los parÃÂ¡metros del lÃÂ¡ser y las pautas para la elecciÃÂ³n de los parÃÂ¡metros operacionales del lÃÂ¡ser, con el fin de optimizar el procedimiento de limpieza.

standard_complete_name: Optics and photonics -- Lasers and laser-related equipment -- Test methods for laser beam power, energy and temporal characteristics
standard_desc_eng: ISO 11554:2017 specifies test methods for determining the power and energy of continuous wave and pulsed laser beams, as well as their temporal characteristics of pulse shape, pulse duration and pulse repetition rate. Test and evaluation methods are also given for the power stability of cw-lasers, energy stability of pulsed lasers and pulse duration stability.
standard_desc_esp: ISO 11554: 2017 especifica los mÃÂ©todos para determinar la potencia y la energÃÂ­a de los haces de lÃÂ¡ser continuos y pulsados, asÃÂ­ como sus caracterÃÂ­sticas temporales: forma, duraciÃÂ³n y frecuencia de repeticiÃÂ³n del pulso. TambiÃÂ©n se proporcionan mÃÂ©todos para medir y evaluar la estabilidad de la potencia de los lÃÂ¡seres continuos y la estabilidad de la energÃÂ­a y de la duraciÃÂ³n del pulso de los lÃÂ¡seres pulsados.

standard_complete_name: Lasers and laser-related equipment -- Test methods for laser-induced damage threshold -- Part 4: Inspection, detection and measurement
standard_type: Two values: 'standard' OR 'method'. When describing a format, use 'standard', when describing a protocol or a set of techniques, use 'method'
standard_desc_eng: ISO/TR 21254-4:2011 describes selected techniques for the inspection of optical surfaces prior to and after damage testing, and damage detection techniques integrated in detection facilities. The described damage detection methods are examples of practical solutions tested and often applied in detection facilities. Also, this direct information on the state of damage can be processed in the course of the running test to determine energy levels for the following interrogations optimised to minimise detection uncertainties. This inspection of the interrogated sites is essential for an accurate determination of the damage thresholds because it is the final and most sensitive assessment of the state of damage.
standard_desc_esp: ISO / TR 21254-4: 2011 describe las tÃÂ©cnicas seleccionadas para la inspecciÃÂ³n de superficies ÃÂ³pticas antes y despuÃÂ©s de pruebas de daÃÂ±o, y las tÃÂ©cnicas de detecciÃÂ³n de daÃÂ±o integradas en instalaciones de detecciÃÂ³n. Los mÃÂ©todos de detecciÃÂ³n de daÃÂ±o descritos son ejemplos de soluciones prÃÂ¡cticas probadas y, a menudo, aplicadas en instalaciones de detecciÃÂ³n. AdemÃÂ¡s, esta informaciÃÂ³n directa sobre el daÃÂ±o producido puede procesarse durante la prueba de determinaciÃÂ³n de los umbrales de energÃÂ­a de daÃÂ±o y asÃÂ­ minimizar las incertidumbres de dicha detecciÃÂ³n. Esta inspecciÃÂ³n es esencial para una determinaciÃÂ³n precisa de los umbrales de daÃÂ±o.

standard_desc_eng: AutoCAD DXF (Drawing Interchange Format, or Drawing Exchange Format) is a CAD data file format developed by Autodesk for enabling data interoperability between AutoCAD and other programs. DXF was originally introduced in December 1982 as part of AutoCAD 1.0, and was intended to provide an exact representation of the data in the AutoCAD native file format, DWG (Drawing), for which Autodesk for many years did not publish specifications. Because of this, correct imports of DXF files have been difficult. Autodesk now publishes the DXF specifications as a PDF on its website. Versions of AutoCAD from Release 10 (October 1988) and up support both ASCII and binary forms of DXF. Earlier versions support only ASCII. As AutoCAD has become more powerful, supporting more complex object types, DXF has become less useful. Certain object types, including ACIS solids and regions, are not documented. Other object types, including AutoCAD 2006's dynamic blocks, and all of the objects specific to the vertical market versions of AutoCAD, are partially documented, but not well enough to allow other developers to support them. For these reasons many CAD applications use the DWG format which can be licensed from Autodesk or non-natively from the Open Design Alliance. DXF coordinates are always without dimensions so that the reader or user needs to know the drawing unit or has to extract it from the textual comments in the sheets.

JPEG ( JAY-peg) is a commonly used method of lossy compression for digital images, particularly for those images produced by digital photography. The degree of compression can be adjusted, allowing a selectable tradeoff between storage size and image quality. JPEG typically achieves 10:1 compression with little perceptible loss in image quality. JPEG compression is used in a number of image file formats. JPEG/Exif is the most common image format used by digital cameras and other photographic image capture devices; along with JPEG/JFIF, it is the most common format for storing and transmitting photographic images on the World Wide Web. These format variations are often not distinguished, and are simply called JPEG. The term "JPEG" is an initialism/acronym for the Joint Photographic Experts Group, which created the standard. The MIME media type for JPEG is image/jpeg, except in older Internet Explorer versions, which provides a MIME type of image/pjpeg when uploading JPEG images. JPEG files usually have a filename extension of .jpg or .jpeg. JPEG/JFIF supports a maximum image size of 65,535ÃÂ65,535 pixels, hence up to 4 gigapixels for an aspect ratio of 1:1.

STL (an abbreviation of "stereolithography") is a file format native to the stereolithography CAD software created by 3D Systems. STL has several after-the-fact backronyms such as "Standard Triangle Language" and "Standard Tessellation Language". This file format is supported by many other software packages; it is widely used for rapid prototyping, 3D printing and computer-aided manufacturing. STL files describe only the surface geometry of a three-dimensional object without any representation of color, texture or other common CAD model attributes. The STL format specifies both ASCII and binary representations. Binary files are more common, since they are more compact. An STL file describes a raw, unstructured triangulated surface by the unit normal and vertices (ordered by the right-hand rule) of the triangles using a three-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system. In the original specification, all STL coordinates were required to be positive numbers, but this restriction is no longer enforced and negative coordinates are commonly encountered in STL files today. STL files contain no scale information, and the units are arbitrary.

Portable Network Graphics (PNG, pronounced PEE-en-JEE or PING) is a raster graphics file format that supports lossless data compression. PNG was created as an improved, non-patented replacement for Graphics Interchange Format (GIF), and is the most widely used lossless image compression format on the Internet. PNG supports palette-based images (with palettes of 24-bit RGB or 32-bit RGBA colors), grayscale images (with or without alpha channel for transparency), and full-color non-palette-based RGB/RGBA images (with or without alpha channel). PNG was designed for transferring images on the Internet, not for professional-quality print graphics, and therefore does not support non-RGB color spaces such as CMYK. A PNG file contains a single image in an extensible structure of "chunks", encoding the basic pixels and other information such as textual comments and integrity checks documented in RFC 2083. PNG files nearly always use file extension PNG or png and are assigned MIME media type image/png. PNG was published as informational RFC 2083 in March 1997 and as an ISO/IEC standard in 2004.

3DS is one of the file formats used by the Autodesk 3ds Max 3D modeling, animation and rendering software. It was the native file format of the old Autodesk 3D Studio DOS (releases 1 to 4), which was popular until its successor (3D Studio MAX 1.0) replaced it in April 1996. Having been around since 1990 (when the first version of 3D Studio DOS was launched), it has grown to become a de facto industry standard for transferring models between 3D programs, or for storing models for 3D resource catalogs (along with OBJ, which is more frequently used as a model archiving file format). While the 3DS format aims to provide an import/export format, retaining only essential geometry, texture and lighting data, the related MAX format (now superseded by the PRJ format) also contains extra information specific to Autodesk 3ds Max, to allow a scene to be completely saved/loaded.

Tagged Image File Format, abbreviated TIFF or TIF, is a computer file format for storing raster graphics images, popular among graphic artists, the publishing industry, and photographers. TIFF is widely supported by scanning, faxing, word processing, optical character recognition, image manipulation, desktop publishing, and page-layout applications. The format was created by Aldus Corporation for use in desktop publishing. It published the latest version 6.0 in 1992, subsequently updated with an Adobe Systems copyright after the latter acquired Aldus in 1994. Several Aldus or Adobe technical notes have been published with minor extensions to the format, and several specifications have been based on TIFF 6.0, including TIFF/EP (ISO 12234-2), TIFF/IT (ISO 12639), TIFF-F (RFC 2306) and TIFF-FX (RFC 3949).

OBJ (or .OBJ) is a geometry definition file format first developed by Wavefront Technologies for its Advanced Visualizer animation package. The file format is open and has been adopted by other 3D graphics application vendors. The OBJ file format is a simple data-format that represents 3D geometry alone â namely, the position of each vertex, the UV position of each texture coordinate vertex, vertex normals, and the faces that make each polygon defined as a list of vertices, and texture vertices. Vertices are stored in a counter-clockwise order by default, making explicit declaration of face normals unnecessary. OBJ coordinates have no units, but OBJ files can contain scale information in a human readable comment line.

The BMP file format, also known as bitmap image file or device independent bitmap (DIB) file format or simply a bitmap, is a raster graphics image file format used to store bitmap digital images, independently of the display device (such as a graphics adapter), especially on Microsoft Windows and OS/2 operating systems. The BMP file format is capable of storing two-dimensional digital images both monochrome and color, in various color depths, and optionally with data compression, alpha channels, and color profiles. The Windows Metafile (WMF) specification covers the BMP file format. Among others, wingdi.h defines BMP constants and structures.

PLY is a computer file format known as the Polygon File Format or the Stanford Triangle Format. It was principally designed to store three-dimensional data from 3D scanners. The data storage format supports a relatively simple description of a single object as a list of nominally flat polygons. A variety of properties can be stored, including: color and transparency, surface normals, texture coordinates and data confidence values. The format permits one to have different properties for the front and back of a polygon. There are two versions of the file format, one in ASCII, the other in binary.

COLLADA (COLLAborative Design Activity) is an interchange file format for interactive 3D applications. It is managed by the nonprofit technology consortium, the Khronos Group, and has been adopted by ISO as a publicly available specification, ISO/PAS 17506. COLLADA defines an open standard XML schema for exchanging digital assets among various graphics software applications that might otherwise store their assets in incompatible file formats. COLLADA documents that describe digital assets are XML files, usually identified with a .dae (digital asset exchange) filename extension.

The METS schema is a standard for encoding descriptive, administrative, and structural metadata regarding objects within a digital library, expressed using the XML schema language of the World Wide Web Consortium. The standard is maintained in the Network Development and MARC Standards Office of the Library of Congress, and is being developed as an initiative of the Digital Library Federation.
standard_desc_fr: METS (Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard) est un schÃÂ©ma XML dÃÂ©veloppÃÂ© ÃÂ  l'initiative de la Digital Library Federation (DLF), et autorisant la crÃÂ©ation et la description intÃÂ©grale (donnÃÂ©es descriptives, administratives et structurelles) d'objets numÃÂ©riques textuels ou graphiques. DestinÃÂ© particuliÃÂ¨rement aux ÃÂ©changes entre institutions patrimoniales, METS est conforme aux recommandations de OAIS (Open Archival Information System) et est maintenu actuellement par la BibliothÃÂ¨que du CongrÃÂ¨s.
standard_desc_deu: Der Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS) ist ein mit XML Schema definiertes XML-Format zur Beschreibung von digitalen Sammlungen von Objekten mit Metadaten.
standard_desc_esp: Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard (METS, EstÃÂ¡ndar de codificaciÃÂ³n y transmisiÃÂ³n de metadatos) es un estÃÂ¡ndar de metadatos para codificar en formato electrÃÂ³nico un documento u objeto dentro de una biblioteca digital. Se utiliza un esquema de lenguaje XML de la World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). La norma es mantenida como parte de los estÃÂ¡ndares MARC (del inglÃÂ©s, MAchine Readable Cataloging) de la Biblioteca del Congreso de Estados Unidos y estÃÂ¡ siendo desarrollado como una iniciativa de la Digital Library Federation (DLF).

standard_desc_eng: The Data Documentation Initiative (DDI) is an international standard for describing the data produced by surveys and other observational methods in the social, behavioral, economic, and health sciences. DDI is a free standard that can document and manage different stages in the research data lifecycle, such as conceptualization, collection, processing, distribution, discovery, and archiving. Documenting data with DDI facilitates understanding, interpretation, and use -- by people, software systems, and computer networks.
standard_desc_fr: Data Documentation Initiative (DDI) est un projet international initiÃÂ© en 1995 destinÃÂ© ÃÂ  crÃÂ©er et maintenir un standard de documentation technique pour dÃÂ©crire et conserver les informations statistiques et plus globalement les informations et donnÃÂ©es d'enquÃÂªtes en sciences humaines et sociales. En effet, la rÃÂ©exploitation des donnÃÂ©es dâenquÃÂªte nÃÂ©cessite une documentation dÃÂ©taillÃÂ©e et fiable pour autoriser de nouveaux traitements statistiques. Cette documentation d'enquÃÂªte est constituÃÂ©e dâune part des instruments de recueil des donnÃÂ©es (questionnaires et formulaires) et des rÃÂ©fÃÂ©rentiels qui ont permis de coder lâinformation (nomenclatures, dictionnaires de codes ou de variables). La standardisation de cette documentation et du format des fichiers qui la compose facilite ÃÂ  la fois la recherche (variÃÂ©tÃÂ© et richesse des modes de recherche dans les rÃÂ©pertoires) et la rÃÂ©exploitation de ces donnÃÂ©es dans de nouvelles ÃÂ©tudes grÃÂ¢ce ÃÂ  la prÃÂ©cision des donnÃÂ©es de contexte.
standard_desc_deu: DDI ist ein offener Standard (Metadatenmodell) fÃÂ¼r die Beschreibung von sozial- und wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Daten.
standard_desc_esp: Data Documentation Initiative (tambiÃÂ©n conocido como DDI o metadatos DDI) es un proyecto internacional que iniciÃÂ³ en 1995 con el fin de crear y mantener un estÃÂ¡ndar de documentaciÃÂ³n tÃÂ©cnica para describir y conservar las informaciones estadÃÂ­sticas y mÃÂ¡s globalmente las informaciones y datos de encuestas en ciencias humanas y sociales. En efecto, la reutilizaciÃÂ³n de los datos de encuestas requiere una documentaciÃÂ³n detallada y confiable para permitir nuevos tratamientos estadÃÂ­sticos. Tal documentaciÃÂ³n consiste, por un lado, en instrumentos de recopilaciÃÂ³n de datos (cuestionarios y formularios) y por otro, de los sistemas de referencia que permiten codificar la informaciÃÂ³n (nomenclaturas, cÃÂ³digos o diccionarios de variables). La estandarizaciÃÂ³n de esta documentaciÃÂ³n y el formato de los archivos que la componen facilita tanto la investigaciÃÂ³n como la reutilizaciÃÂ³n de estos datos en nuevos estudios gracias a la precisiÃÂ³n de los datos contextuales.

standard_desc_eng: LIDO (Lightweight Information Describing Objects) is an XML schema for describing museum objects. It is applicable to all kinds of objects: art, natural history, technology, cultural objects. LIDO is widely used for harvesting museum data in union catalogs, and as a preliminary step for converting to semantic formats like CIDOC CRM or EDM.

Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language like HTML. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and JavaScript. CSS is designed to enable the separation of presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts. This separation can improve content accessibility, provide more flexibility and control in the specification of presentation characteristics, enable multiple web pages to share formatting by specifying the relevant CSS in a separate .css file, and reduce complexity and repetition in the structural content.

This CSS module specifies how pages are generated and laid out to hold fragmented content in a paged presentation. It adds functionality for controlling page margins, page size and orientation, and headers and footers, and extends generated content to enable page numbering and running headers/footers. The process of paginating a flow into such generated pages is covered in CSS3-BREAK. CSS is a language for describing the rendering of structured documents (such as HTML and XML) on screen, on paper, etc.

XSL-FO (XSL Formatting Objects) is a markup language for XML document formatting that is most often used to generate PDF files. XSL-FO is part of XSL (Extensible Stylesheet Language), a set of W3C technologies designed for the transformation and formatting of XML data. The other parts of XSL are XSLT and XPath. Version 1.1 of XSL-FO was published in 2006.

XSL is a language for expressing style sheets. An XSL style sheet is, like with CSS, a file that describes how to display an XML document of a given type. XSL shares the functionality and is compatible with CSS2 (although it uses a different syntax). It also adds a transformation language for XML documents: XSLT. Originally intended to perform complex styling operations, like the generation of tables of contents and indexes, it is now used as a general purpose XML processing language. XSLT is thus widely used for purposes other than XSL, like generating HTML web pages from XML data.

ApacheÃ¢ÂÂ¢ FOP (Formatting Objects Processor) is a print formatter driven by XSL formatting objects (XSL-FO) and an output independent formatter. It is a Java application that reads a formatting object (FO) tree and renders the resulting pages to a specified output. Output formats currently supported include PDF, PS, PCL, AFP, XML (area tree representation), Print, AWT and PNG, and to a lesser extent, RTF and TXT. The primary output target is PDF

is an XML-based format for representing InDesign content. Essentially, it is a major revision of INX, InDesignâs previous XML-based file format. IDML addresses INX shortcomings, in an effort to represent InDesign content in a human-readable formatâsomething that can be reasonably assembled and  disassembled by a competent XML programmer.

A comma-separated values (CSV) file is a delimited text file that uses a comma to separate values. A CSV file stores tabular data (numbers and text) in plain text. Each line of the file is a data record. Each record consists of one or more fields, separated by commas. The use of the comma as a field separator is the source of the name for this file format. RFC 4180 formalized CSV. It defines the MIME type "text/csv", and CSV files that follow its rules should be very widely portable

standard_complete_name: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
standard_desc_eng: ASCII abbreviated from American Standard Code for Information Interchange, is a character encoding standard for electronic communication. ASCII codes represent text in computers, telecommunications equipment, and other devices. Most modern character-encoding schemes are based on ASCII, although they support many additional characters. ASCII is the traditional name for the encoding system.

The Thermo Scientific SPC file format is a generic format used in all of Thermo Scientific\'s software products. In addition, many spectrometer vendors\' software packages offer capabilities to export spectral data to the Thermo Scientific SPC format or use it as their native file format. All the converters and translators used on this site create Thermo Scientific SPC files from the submitted spectral data files before presenting them to the library search engine on this site. Submitting data files in the Thermo Scientific SPC format is the most reliable way to guarantee that your data is interpreted correctly for searching against the databases. The Thermo Scientific SPC file format is completely public domain information.

standard_complete_name: JCAMP-DX: A Standard Form for the Exchange of Infrared Spectra in Computer Readable Form
standard_desc_eng: CAMP-DX is a standard file form for exchange of infrared spectra and related chemical and physical information between spectrometer data systems of different manufacture, main-frame time-sharing systems, general purpose lab computers, and personal computers. It is compatible with all media: telephone, magnetic and optical disk, magnetic tape, and even the printed page (via optical reader). All data are stored as labeled fields of variable length using printable ASCII characters. A JCAMP-DX spectrum is a text file which can be viewed, corrected, and annotated with a text editor. The present focus is on infrared spectra, but JCAMP-DX can easily accommodate Raman, UV, NMR, mass, and other types of spectra, x-ray powder patterns, chromatograms, thermograms, and other plots which require the capability of representing contours as well as peak position and intensity. JCAMP-DX also provides for combining adequate information about the sample and method of observation with its spectrum.

There is a plethora of established and proposed document representation formats but none that can adequately support individual stages within an entire sequence of document image analysis methods (from document image enhancement to layout analysis to OCR) and their evaluation. This paper describes PAGE, a new XML-based page image representation framework that records information on image characteristics (image borders, geometric distortions and corresponding corrections, binarisation etc.) in addition to layout structure and page content. The suitability of the framework to the evaluation of entire workflows as well as individual stages has been extensively validated by using it in high-profile applications such as in public contemporary and historical ground-truthed datasets and in the ICDAR Page Segmentation competition series.

hOCR is an open standard for representing document layout analysis and OCR results as a subset of HTML. The goal is to reuse as much existing technology as possible, and to arrive at a representation that makes it easy to store, share, process and display OCR results. This specification defines many features that can represent a variety of OCR-related information. However, being built on top of HTML, hOCR is designed to make it easy to start simple and gradually use more complex constructs when necessary. Consider you have an HTML document that encodes a book: Wrapping page elements in <div class="ocr_page"> tags will convey the page boundaries to hOCR-capable agents and turn the HTML document into an hOCR document.

standard_desc_fr: Freanch Desc
standard_desc_eng: English DEsc
